sentences: Need sarnased mängud on väga huvitavad.
Nende arvutite tehnilised omadused on sarnased.
Meie meeleolu ja omaette oleme üsna sarnased.
context: The word 'sarnased' is the plural nominative form of the adjective 'sarnane', which means similar or alike. It's used to describe multiple things that have similarities in characteristics, appearance, qualities, or other attributes. In Estonian grammar, this form would be used when modifying a plural subject in the nominative case.
